title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: South Park Elementary, day. Butters stands in front of the class witha small volcano - his science experiment.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...And so, just like in nature, ah I can add the mixture into the volcano and...

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: O Pele! God of Fire! Show us you uh-

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: [the belching volcano draws his attention as it coughs up the
text: "lava"] Aw, it's all uh g-gooey.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Okay, good job, Butters. You get a check.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ah, thank you, Ms. Choksondik!  I got a check. That's like a C!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Okay. Whose project should we look at next? How aboouuut Eric?  Eric Cartman?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Stand by, please.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: NOW Eric!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, God-damnit!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Haha

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Shutup, Jew!  Yes, well. For my project, I made a pencil, taped to a pen. In this way we see the duality of writing devices that occur in nature.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You just put that thing together just now! I'm giving you a check minus.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh GOD-DAMNIT I HATE CHECK-MINUS!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Siddown

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'll make you eat your parents!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What did you say?!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Nothing!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright, Token, you're next.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Using my laptop computer, I hooked into the Internet and found a meteorology Web site.  I donwloaded the data, and with my dad's video projector, I can show you the graph I made of predictable weather patterns over the next three months.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Wwooww.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I also printed out the results on my color printer. Here you are, Ms. Choksondik.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Very very good, Token. You get a check plus.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Aw, that is such bullcrap!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Eric, for the love of God.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: No! No, see, this is the fundamental flaw with the check check-plus check-minus system! The only reason Token was able to do all that is because his family is rich!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: My family isn't rich.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, come on, Token! Your new house is four times the size of anyone else's in town! And who else gets crab cakes and, and lobster tail in their lunch boxes?!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Your family is rich, dude.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: But I...

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Let's just see where Token's clothes come from, shall we?  Ooooo, Armani Exchange!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Aharmani Exchange?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: All the rest of us have to buy our clothes at J mart! Have you even been inside a J mart, Token?!  I didn't think so!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, dude, your family is so rich they have their own pool table.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah. And their own sprinkler system. You don't think you're rich?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Token's house, after school. His parents are at the sofa. His father reads a newspaper; his mother, a book. Token walks in

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hello Token. How was school today?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Mom? Dad? Why do we have a bigger house than everybody else in South Park?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, because we have more money, son.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I know. But why?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...W-well, because we went to graduate school and therefore have more lucrative jobs than most people in town. For instance, your mother is a chemist for a pharmaceutical company, whereas your friend Eric Cartman's mother is a crack whore. One pays more than the other.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Why, sweetie? What's the matter?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: All the kids at school made fun of me today because I'm rich.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I don't wanna be rich anymore! I wanna eat macaroni and cheese for dinner and, and and wear clothes from J mart!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: J mart?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Son, you, you don't know what you're saying.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I just wanna be like all the other kids in South Park. Please, Mom and Dad, please.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: J mart, later. A small SUV pulls into the J mart lot. Token takes his first look at J mart. He is awed by it and pleased at the chance to shop there.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You... sure you want to do this, son?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'm sure.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hmmm...

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Where's the... valet?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: He must be parkiing someone else's car.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ah, here we go.  Take good care of it, please.  Here's twenty dollars.  Hoh? They've activated some kind of alien blinding device.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: That's not a blinding device, Dad. It's flourescent lighting.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Excuse me, where can where would we find young men's fashion apparel?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Aisle 6, next to the pretzels.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Next to the-?!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Come on!  Hey look: there pants are only five bucks apiece. They must really suck. What do ya think?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What, what brand are they?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: It doesn't matter, Mom. They're poor people pants.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hey, uh, Sharon? Isn't that the Williamses?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Huh?  Oh. Yeah, it is.  What are they doing here? They can afford to shop at Cherry Creek.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Do you see that, Sheila? The Williamses are shopping here.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I don't get it. He must pull in at least two hundred thousand a year.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: S-son, can you just hurry it up? I don't think we quite fit n here.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, looks like you landed on Park Avenue, Stan. You own me ten million dollars.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hey you guys.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh hey, dude. Did you bring the movie?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hey, you changed your clothes, Token.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, well, you know, I did a little shopping at J mart.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright, well, let's just watch the Lion King. Cartman's cheating anyway.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Here you go.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What's that?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: It's a DVD of the Lion King

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: DVD? We don't own a DVD player.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, dude.  Nobody does. They're too expensive.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Not too expensive for Token's rich ass family, apparently.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Don't you have a VHS of it?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I only have this.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, well, let me take this disk up to the Enterprise and see if Captain Kirk can decrypt it.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What's a VHS?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, Jesus, dude.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Come on, guys. We'll jsut have to find other stuff to do.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What's a VHS?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Token looks at the DVD, then at the boys, then at the DVD. He lets the DVD case fall to the floor on top of the DVD and leaves the house. Music comes up as he leaves the Marsh house

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Why can't I be like all the other kids?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: sees Kenny and brother Kevin playing on their lawn. Kenny is flying around getting dizzy while Kevin plays with a deflated basketball.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: They all have three-bedroom homes, broken trucks on their lawns.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: hops onto a wooden box and peeks in - he sees Butters eating

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: And cut-up hot dogs for lunch

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: It's not my fault my parents succeed so much.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: leaves the window and walks over to Stark's Pond, then sits and pulls out a dollar coin from a small collection. The pond has thawed, and lily pods can be seen on the water. Token tosses the coin, and it skips across the water. He then walks on and stops across the street from the South Park Welfare Office. Craig and his family leave the office with their welfare check as Cartman and mom walk in.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: There's no one in town I can relate to.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: I play with autographed baseball bats

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: he fades into a baseball uniform and holds a bat with Barry Bonds' signature on it

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: while everyone else just plays with sticks and pine cones

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: across the street he sees a baseball game, with Kyle pitching, Cartman catching, Stan at bat, Clyde in left field, and three other boys. Sticks and cones are being used. Stan hits the cone. It sails away and Stan rounds the bases

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: Has a boy ever felt so alone?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: drops his bat and glove and walks away, then stops and gets a look of determination.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: Well, who needs them anyway? I won't pretend to be something
text: I'm not

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: rushes home and goes to his desk to work on something - a 2-page tabloid ad extolling South Park as the next Aspen

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: If I can't be poor, I've got to deal with what I've got.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: If I can't be like them, what I need is more rich kids around,

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: So I'm not the only one, and then I won't be so... down.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: he finishes, puts the ad into a sturdy envelope addressed to Forbes Magazine Department with some bills, and goes to the window to look at the sunset. Outside, the camera pulls back from the window

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: Please, God, send more rich kids...

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: As the camera pulls back, Token's house is shown to be big indeed, with a three- or four-car garage set back some distance from the street. To the right, two more houses appear, but they are small next to the Williams house.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Next shot, a mansion in the Hollywood Hills. An address is shown

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: the camera pulls back to show Smith reading Forbes Magazine

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ooo, look at this, honey.  A beautiful unspoiled town in the Rockies. This is just what we've been looking for!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "Like Aspen was 30 years ago." Sounds nice.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: We could buy hundreds of acres of land for next to nothing! And then I could finally live like a cowboy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh Will, the country would be such a nicer place to raise our kids!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: O kids?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes, Daddy?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: How would you like to move to the Colorado Rockies?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The mountains, Daddy?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Can we have horses?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: O can we? Can we Daddy?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You bet!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hooray!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: South Park, soon after, day. A new four-story mansion rises in a new lot. A crane positions the new fountain in a circular driveway in front of the mansion. Token grins as he watches the laborers work. A limosine and a moving truck pull up behind him. Will Smith and family pour out of the limo

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, here it is. Our home to be.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, Will, it's beautiful.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hi! Welcome to the neighborhood!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Why thank you, young man. We're the Smiths.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ah, a local boy. You shall be our nwe playmate. I'm Frederick. This is my sister Lisa, and my brother Daniel

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'm Token.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Our daddy is a very famous actor. What does your daddy do?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Aah, he's a lawyer. I think.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: How quaint. Kids, why don't you play with little Token while your mother and I check out the town.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Very well. Come, local boy.  Show us how to play your mountain games.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: All right!  Thanks, God.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Token's mansion, later. Token leads the Smith kids on a tour of the mansion

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...And this is the room where my mom and dad keep their original v-Van Gogh painting.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes, yes, we have one of those, too. In fact, we have seven of them, I believe.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You do? God, that's great!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Why?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'm just so happy you guys moved into town. You see, I used to be the only rich kid. All the other families here are kinda  low to  middle-income.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Why? What happened to all their money?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, they never really had any money.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, then, why don't their daddies just act in a movie?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well I... think that.. they...

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Sometimes children must be very firm with their daddies.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Indeed.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Like when Daddy doesn't want to act in a movie because he thinks the script is bad.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: So we must plead with him:  "Please, Daddy, please! It's twenty million dollard, Daddy."

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "Please, Daddy, please!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "Twenty million is still twelve million after taxes, Daddy!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "I want a llama, Daddy!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "I'd do the picture, Daddy!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "Please, Daddy!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "Daddy, please!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "Daddy, do the movie, Daddy!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "But Daddy!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And so Daddy does the picture.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...That's ...great.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Twenty million dollars great.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: A recording studio. A rapper is laying down some tracks.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I found a girl who had an innie and I felt her with my jimmy

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: Player-haters try to do me 'cause my rhymes are just tooo-

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Sorry, Snoop Dogg, but Will Smith is on line three for you?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh.  William! How are you buddy?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Great, Snoop Dogg, and you?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Couldn't be better. I'm just laying down some vocals for my new album.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Great, Snoop-Snoop. Listen: Remember how we always talked about wanting to buy property up in the mountains so our kids could ski and ride horses?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oho yes, the kids bug me about it all the time.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well I found the place, Snooty-roo. It's in the Rockies, but totally undiscovered, laid-back, and beautiful.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ogh. It sounds lovely!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You really should come give it a look. Jada and I would love for some friends to move here with us.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I certainly will, William. And perhaps I'll give ol' Maigc and Kobe Bryant a call. They've been looking for vacation properties as well.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Great! Well, let me let you get back to your recording.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hah, see you soon. Bye.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Bye.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright, let's take it from the top, gang.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
role: I shout "Hell Yeah!" from my vehicle. Livin' is a miracle-

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: South Park, day. Another rich family moves into town. Jimbo, Ned, and Mr. Garrison watch from across the street.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Look, there's more of them moving into our town.  You know, Oprah Winfrey is building a house up on Cannon, and some Snoop Doggy Doo Doo buildin' a gigantic place up on Main.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yep, there goes the neighborhood.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: That's the fifth family of them that's moved here. Seems like all of a sudden South Park is being overrun by those types.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hey! W-what are you saying? What "types"?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yiou know, those types! Rich people!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh. I don't take kindly to rich folk. Neither does Ned.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Nnnope.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I remember back in the day, RICH folk weren't alLOWED in South Park! Now thery're movin' here in droves!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: They're gonna be sending their kids to our schools, and mixin' them with our pure, non-rich kids!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, yeah, and it won't be long before they drove all of us poor underachieving people out of town with inflated real-estate costs!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Damn, I hate those stupid richers!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah.  Hey, rich guy!  Hey, Richie Rich! Yeah, I'm talkin' to you, richer! What's in the huge box, richer?! Your checkbook?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah. How many rich people does it take to screw in a light bulb? None! They can hire people to do it for them!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah. Hey, hey, you guys know why richers have such big garages? 'Cause they need a place for all their Porsches and boats and aircraft carriers!  Yeah, that's right, cashchucker! Go have fun with your two million dollar house!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I guess we showed them!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Another house, nearby. A crane is positioning a swimming pool. Oprah Winfrey directs the workers from the edge of the lawn

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: A little to the left. That's great and- Let's put another pool over there. Uh huh, good.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Token, these are Oprah's newly-adopted children, Dominique and Zizi.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hello.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hi.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Cheerio!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ah, and these are Puff Daddy's kids: P Diddy Mini, P Poofy Bite-size, and Poppa Diddy Diddy Puff Fun-size.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Wow, my plan to get rich people here sure did work. Hey, I got a great idea! Let's all pack some lunches and go sledding.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh no, we're going shopping.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Shopping!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes, come Token. We're all going to head down to the mall and buy some of the stores.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh. Alright then.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The local bar, night. It's pretty busy, with people chatting away and enjoying their beer. Some motion is seen outside the doors, and soon they open. Three rich men enter and scan the bar, then move to a nearby table and sit. One of them is Kobe Bryant

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: 'Scuse me, can ew get a couple of beers here?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: They've got nice expensive beers for you across the street at the new Wolfgang Puck's.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: That's alright, we just want some cheap beer tonight.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...Maybe you didn't see the sign out front: This bar is for people livin' below their means ONLY!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: This is a free country. I can have a drink wherever I want.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Come on, Kobe, let's just go.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: This ain't over! This ain't over by a long shot!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Those richers are getting snooty. We've got to show those richers they're not welcome here!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Nn-what do you mean?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: How about tonight, we sneak up to one of their houses, and right on their lawn we'll set fire to a big lowercase t!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Lowercase t?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, for "time to leave"!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Jimbo, you take some folk and build a big wooden lowercase t! I'll take the rest and get some gas and torches ready!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Kobe's mansion, night. Through a bay window he's seen reading his newspaper in an armchair near a fireplace. A FOOM is heard and a flicker of light is reflected on the walls outside Kobe's house. He notices, takes a hard look, rises from his chair and goes to the front door. He opens it, annoyed, but his expression changes to one of fright. He sees the lowercase t burning on the lawn

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Tee. T- Time to- leave?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: T is for "time to leave," cashchucker!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'm callin' the police.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I think we scared 'im.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah. Next house we'll do a capital T, to show 'em we REALLY mean business!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: South Park, new polo grounds, day. A group of rich kids gather to begin a polo game. They all ride on ponies.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Now Token, polo is very simple. You simply must hit the williard into some cilium with your fracaman.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, yeah, but can't we just play without these uncomfortable uniforms?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: "Can't we play without the uniforms?" Yes, um. Lert's eat caviar without Bellini's as well!  Now come, Token, and remeber: it doesn't matter who wins. It matters who wins three times in a row. Tally ho!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Tally ho!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yay!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: This is exciting.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, Frederick, this is wonderful!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What in the hell are they doing?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Is that fun?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I don't know. We don't have horses, so we can't play.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, let's just play our game, then.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright, I'll start. I'll kick you in the nuts, Kenny!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: (Ow!)

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'll kick you in the nuts, Stan!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'll kick you in the nuts, Cartman!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Kick his nutsack!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You see, you must pay attention, Token. I was able to jollyrow your davishmere with a forecastle.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: This game is too confusing. How about we have a snowball fight?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: A snowball fight?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: How barbaric.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes, Token, if you want to play such savage games, I suggest you go live with lions.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I don't fit in anywhere.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: South Park, another part of town. Bill Cosby and his two kids

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: -ar. We're going to the zoo, and we can eat Jerro pudding.  Ah, this is goin' to be fun kids. We're goin' to the zoo, we could eat the Jerro pudding and chocolate cake.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hey! What are you doing? If you're going to ride the bus in South Park, you're gonna have to sit in the FRONT!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, that's where the first-class seating is!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah. How do you like that, richer?!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well it's very nice, actually

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, I'll bet it is!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Very, very comfy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Uh huh, looks like it.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: A field, a while later. Token stands there talking to someone

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hello, my name is Token. I don't fit in with all the kids at South Park Elementary so, I invited a bunch of rich kids to move to town. The problem is, I don't fit in with them, either. That's why I've come to live with you.  So if you'll have me and raise me as one of your own, I promise to be the best lion I could be.  Uuuh, yeah.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Chef's house, day. Chef is seen shoveling snow off his driveway

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Shovel that snow, babih, it's all nice, heavy and wet. Just-

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You there, come march with us!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: For what?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: All the poor people in town think they can persecute and harass us decent rich folk.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: So we're uniting and marching on the town square!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The Million Millionaire March!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Come on, brother!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: But... I'm not rich.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I'm just a school cafeteria chef. Ahah I don't make much money.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: We'll give you a hundred dollars.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Woo, fudge the snow now.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I shall perservere. We shall perservere.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The lions' lair at the zoo, later. Token takes a raw steak and bites into it, growling

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: RRrrr!!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Look at the little black lion, Mommy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: He's cute, isn't he?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Roar!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What are you doing here, boy?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You- you talked. I, I understood you. I must be becoming a lion!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You're not becoming a lion. The only way you can do that is to see Aslan.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Who's Aslan?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Very well, walk this way.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Is this the boy who's been living in our realm?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Are... you... Aslan?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: M-I am.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, I'm Token

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: So, you want to live with the lions, do you?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes. Um. Great Aslan. I don't fit in anywhere else.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And what makes you think you can fit it with us?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well, I don't know.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Do you like jokes?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Jokes! You know, funny, hahaaa. Us lions love jokes.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...I like jokes a lot.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Mmm. Then there may be hoipe in you yet, young apprentice lion. Very well. We wihill let you stay, if... you can pull this thorn from my paw.  Go on, try it. Pull my thorn! Come on! Pull my thorm!  Ho ho ho ho ho ho! Ho ho!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: So can I stay?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: He-you may. But being a lion may be harder than you think.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The local bar, later. The bar patrons watch a TV as a report is heard. Seen are Mr. Garrison, Randy, Stuart, Skeeter, Gerald, Jimbo, and Ned.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: A billion billionaires are gathering their ranks and will be marchng on the town square tonight  in South Park to petition the end of separate bars, bus seating and restaurants. It looks like it will be a great turnout, as some of the millionaires also paid several thousand Mexicans to march for them.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: If they get that petition passed, it's all over.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I guess we learned our lesson: you can't fight rich folk; they're just too powerful.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Now, come on! Is that any way to talk?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: They won, Garrison. They can't be scared out of town.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: No! We just haven't scared them the right way! Think about it. What scares rich people more than anything?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...Ghosts?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Bingo! Rich people don't want to live in South Park if they think it's HAUNTED!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Everyonen get some sheets from home! If we can't chase the richers out, we'll spook 'em out!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright! Yeah! Let's Go! Right!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The zoo, lion's lair, night. The lions have eaten and lay about on the boulders. One by one, they belch and the others laugh. Token sets his bowl down...

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Huuuunh  Aslan.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes? What is it, young lion apprentice?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...I thnk I'm gonna go home now.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Home. But I thought your friends made fun of you at home.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: They do. But, I guess I learned something today. You see, even though kids at South Park make fun of me, I still like hanging around them more than snobby rich kids or, lions. Even though I may be different from them, I still like my old friends best.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: It sounds like you learned much, young lion apprentice. Very well. But before you go, perhaps you would like... a stick of gum?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: ...No thanks.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Go on. It's spearmint!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: No, because there's a spring in there, and if I pull the gum out, it's gonna hurt my finger.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh. So you don't want any gum then? Are you... sure? Go on, try it!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ow.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: That is good stuhuff!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Jesus, lions suck!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: South Park town square, night, in front of the Mayor's office. The billionaires are present, and Will Smith is at the podium

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And so it is with great determination that us decent rich Americans have gathered to say: "We will be separated no more!"

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hooray!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: This certainly has been an enlightening evening. And as Mayor, I accept your petition and will abolish all separation laws.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And I want to assure the nation that is watching that South Park is not a town of prejudice or bigotry.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Woooooo!!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What the-?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: God no.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: AAAaaahhh!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Carl, do you see what I see?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yes, Martin. I do believe this town is hainted.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Kids! Go find the limo and get in!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You didn't tell me this town was hainted!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: I didn't know!  I.. DIDN'T... KNOHOHOHOW...

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: It's working!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: They're scared to death!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: A mansion, the same one Mr. Garrison and the men saw earlier as they commented on the new richers moving in, night. The family rushes towrads the front door

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Pack up your things quickly! We've got to get out of here!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The town, night. "Ghosts" continue to chase the millionaires around. In the background, Stan leads a group of boys down the street. With him are Kyle, Cartman, Butters, Pip, Tweek, Clyde, and Craig

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh hey, there's Token.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hey guys.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Dude, we're gonna play football. Do you wanna play?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You mean, you want me around?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Sure, dude, you're our friend.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, I know. But you guys always rip on me for bein' rich.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Dude, just because we rip on you for being rich doesn't mean we don't like you.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah. We're guys, dude. We find something about all our friends to rip on. We made fun of you for being rich just like we make fun of Butters for being wimpy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: They sure do.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, like we rip on Kyle for being a Jew.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Right.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: That's right, huh?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And Stan for being in love with Wendy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, I get it for that.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And Cartman for being fat

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Uh huh.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And Cartman for being stupid

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And Cartman for having a whore for a mom.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Hey!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: And Cartman for being a sadistic asshole

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ey, you did me already!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You're right, guys. From now on, I'm fine with being made fun of for being rich.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Oh, but we're not gonna rip on you for being rich anymore.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: You're not?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: No dude. Because since you got your feelings so hurt for being ripped on, now we think you're a pussy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah, so now you're a pussy. Pussaholic.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Come on, Nurse Token. We're gonna play football, you puss.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Pussy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Heh yeah, later, puss.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Ha, that guy's a pussy.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Wait! I liked being ripped on for being rich better!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: The rich enclave, later. The men of South Park have succeeded in chasing the rich folks out of town, and they gather in front of a mansion. They take off their sheets

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: That was it. We just saw the last of them speeding away in a van!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Alright!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: They were so scared, I'm sure they'll never be back!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: That's great! And now we can sell all their homes, and become... millionaires!

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: What?

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: But then you had us do all that for nothin'. Don't you see: If you get rich sellin' these homes, then there will still be rich people in South Park.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Yeah. You'd become what you hate.

title: HERE COMES THE NEIGHBORHOOD
text: Well yeah, but at least I got rid of all those damn ni-
